intro: Myrciaria leucophloea var. warmingiana, commonly known as the white-flowered myrtle, is a tropical shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, white flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange to red in color when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal regions. The varietal form, warmingiana, is distinguished by its pale, almost white floral buds and foliage.
